TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataServiceCollection`1<T> extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection`1<!T>
Public Class DataServiceCollection(Of T) Inherits ObservableCollection(Of T)
generic <typename T> public ref class DataServiceCollection : System::Collections::ObjectModel::ObservableCollection<T>

Docs.summary: Represents a dynamic entity collection that provides notifications when items get added, removed, or when the list is refreshed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[ssAstoria](~/includes/ssastoria-md.md)] provides the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> class to support binding data to controls in client applications. This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601> class, which implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> interface and is the primary data binding mechanism for Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) and Silverlight-based applications.
You can load an <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601> binding collection by using any collection that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface. Items loaded into the binding collection must implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> interface. For more information, see [Binding Data to Controls](~/docs/framework/data/wcf/binding-data-to-controls-wcf-data-services.md).
## Examples The following example is from the code-behind page for an Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) page that defines the `SalesOrders` window in WPF. When the window is loaded, an <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> is created based on the result of a query that returns customers with related objects, filtered by country. This result is bound to the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel> that is the root layout control for the WPF window.
[!code-csharp[Astoria Northwind Client#WpfDataBinding](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/astoria northwind client/cs/customerorderswpf.xaml.cs#wpfdatabinding)] [!code-vb[Astoria Northwind Client#WpfDataBinding](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/astoria northwind client/vb/customerorderswpf.xaml.vb#wpfdatabinding)]
The following is the XAML that defines the `SalesOrders` window in WPF for the previous example.
[!code-xaml[Astoria Northwind Client#WpfDataBindingXaml](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/astoria northwind client/vb/customerorderswpf.xaml#wpfdatabindingxaml)]

Docs.related: Binding Data to Controls (WCF Data Services)

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
Automatic change tracking begins after items are loaded into the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of objects supplied for `items` is usually a query that returns the items in the collection. However, any <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of the correct type can be supplied.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create an empty <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> to which entity objects can be added without executing a query against the service or when an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> is not available.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. Use this class constructor and supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for `trackingMode` to create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of objects supplied for `items` is usually a query that returns the items in the collection. However, any <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> collection of the correct type can be supplied.

## Remarks Use this constructor to create an empty <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> to which entity objects can be added without executing a query against the service or when an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> is not available.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `entityChanged` and `collectionChanged` functions are invoked by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> events, respectively. The `entityChanged` method takes an <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityCollectionChangedParams> value and the `collectionChanged` method takes a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityChangedParams> value. Both methods must return a Boolean value that indicates whether the event was handled by the function. When the method returns `true`, the default behavior still occurs.
By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. You can create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking when you create an instance using a constructor that enables you to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode>. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, automatic change tracking is enabled for a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>. Use this class constructor to supply a value of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.TrackingMode.None> for `trackingMode` to create an instance of <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> that uses manual change tracking. When you use manual tracking, you must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> and handle the raise events to manually report changes to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.
The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> must be supplied when `items` is not a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery%601> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse%601> that has a reference to a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> instance.
The `entityChanged` and `collectionChanged` functions are invoked by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged> and <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> events, respectively. The `entityChanged` method takes an <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityCollectionChangedParams> value and the `collectionChanged` method takes a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.EntityChangedParams> value. Both methods must return a Boolean value that indicates whether the event was handled by the function. When the method returns `true`, the default behavior will still occur.

Docs.param: When , detaches all items from the .
Docs.summary: Removes all items from the collection, and optionally detaches all the items from the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When an item is detached, all related objects in the data graph are also detached from the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Continuation As DataServiceQueryContinuation(Of T)

public: property System::Data::Services::Client::DataServiceQueryContinuation<T> ^ Continuation { System::Data::Services::Client::DataServiceQueryContinuation<T> ^ get(); void set(System::Data::Services::Client::DataServiceQueryContinuation<T> ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a continuation object that is used to return the next set of paged results.
Docs.value: A object that contains the URI to return the next set of paged results.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Continuation%2A> property returns a link that is used to access the next set of paged results when paging is enabled in the data service. For more information, see [Configuring the Data Service](~/docs/framework/data/wcf/configuring-the-data-service-wcf-data-services.md).
When loading a paged result into a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>, you must explicitly load pages by calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7B%600%7D%29> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> by passing the result of the execution of the URI that was obtained from the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Continuation%2A> property.
## Examples The following example is from the code-behind page for an Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) page that defines the `SalesOrders` window in WPF. When the window is loaded, a <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> is created based on the result of a query that returns customers, filtered by country. All of the pages of this paged result are loaded, along with the related orders, and are bound to the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel> that is the root layout control for the WPF window. For more information, see [How to: Bind Data to Windows Presentation Foundation Elements](~/docs/framework/data/wcf/bind-data-to-wpf-elements-wcf-data-services.md).
[!code-csharp[Astoria Northwind Client#BindPagedData](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/astoria northwind client/cs/customerorderswpf3.xaml.cs#bindpageddata)] [!code-vb[Astoria Northwind Client#BindPagedData](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/astoria northwind client/vb/customerorderswpf3.xaml.vb#bindpageddata)]

Docs.related: Binding Data to Controls (WCF Data Services)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Detach() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disables tracking of all items in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Detach%2A> method can only be called when <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601> is the root collection.
When the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Detach%2A> method is called on a collection that is a root collection, tracking is also stopped for all related objects in the data graph.

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InsertItem(int32 index, !T item) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub InsertItem (index As Integer, item As T)
protected: override void InsertItem(int index, T item);

Docs.param: Index at which to add the item.
The item to add.
Docs.summary: Adds a specified item to the collection at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you are manually tracking changes to the collection, you must override the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.InsertItem%2A> method to prevent items from being automatically added to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Load(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!T> items) cil managed
Public Sub Load (items As IEnumerable(Of T))

Docs.param: Collection of entity objects to be added to the .
Docs.summary: Loads a collection of entity objects into the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method attaches all objects in the collection, if they are not already attached to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> that is associated with the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.
When an object is attached by using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method, all related objects are also attached.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Load(!T item) cil managed

Docs.param: Entity object to be added.
Docs.summary: Loads a single entity object into the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method attaches the object, if it is not already attached to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> that is associated with the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601>.
When an object is attached by using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceCollection%601.Load%2A> method, all related objects are also attached.
